data.title: Crack the password

testCases.title: Multiple candidates
testCases.testIn:
te?m?
8
means
mimes
eaten
trims
meets
tombs
thumb
metro

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
s?in?
5
think
songs
stint
noisy
sprig

testCases.title: Exclude differing length
testCases.testIn:
tsr?
5
arty

star
trees

testCases.title: Exclude partial match

7
less
plus
pose

pest

testCases.title: Validator 5

testCases.title: Repeated letters
testCases.testIn:

testCases.title: Long words
testCases.testIn:

10

testCases.title: Validator 7

?gs?b??c?
10

backstage
obscuring
observing

screening
combining
branching

substance

data.constraints:
All letters in [[pattern]] and [[word]] are in lowercase.
1 ≤ [[size]] ≤ 10
data.stubGenerator:
read pattern:word(10)
read size:int
loop size read word:string(10) 
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> A string [[pattern]] containing known letters of the password with 1 or more {{?}} characters whose letter is unknown. The letters are scrambled.
<<Line 2 :>> A single integer [[size]] for the length of the word list
<<Next [[size]] lines :>> A [[word]] from the word list
data.outputDescription: <<1 or more lines :>> A list of candidate words that might be the password. One word per line in the same order as the word list. Output {{none}} if no candidates are found.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Billy loves playing video games but his dad thinks it's a waste of time so he keeps the computer password protected. Determined to satiate his gaming appetite, Billy enlists his friend to spy on his dad the next time he logs in.

His friend discovers that to help remember the password, Billy's dad pulls out a list of words printed on a sheet and finds his password from the list! Furthermore, his friend only saw some of the letters he typed as he was logging in.

Objective: Help Billy find the password by narrowing down the list using his friend's intel! In case Billy's friend made a mistake and there are no candidates, output none
Input
Line 1 : A string pattern containing known letters of the password with 1 or more ? characters whose letter is unknown. The letters are scrambled.
Line 2 : A single integer size for the length of the word list
Next size lines : A word from the word list
Output
1 or more lines : A list of candidate words that might be the password. One word per line in the same order as the word list. Output none if no candidates are found.
Constraints
All letters in pattern and word are in lowercase.
1 ≤ size ≤ 10
Example
Input
?nae
2
lane
line
Output
lane
